item.title: [REP ++] [317] Compiling Help [317] [REP ++]
item.dc:creator: @SacredHeart SacredHeart
item.description:
@SacredHeart wrote:

[quote=“x1 att ftw x, post:8, topic:375621”]Try putting this in your compiler mite work

@echo off
@TITLE l33tpwnzscape source Compiler
echo Compiling…
if exist “%programfiles(x86)%\Java” (call :compile “%programfiles(x86)%\Java”) else (goto error)
:compile
for /D %%x in ("%~1jdk*") do (set p="%%~x\bin\javac.exe")
if defined p (%p% -cp . *.java)
if defined p (goto end)
:error
echo You do not have Java installed. Please download it at the site that is about to load.
:end
echo Finished!
pause
exit

my jdk is in the same path as yours program files (x86)\java\jdk… yah so put that in your edit file it mite work[/quote]
Still get the same error.

Phaze One:

I have received that error when I had one or more versions of JDK on my computer. Try setting your environment variables.

My path is this;
C:\Program Files\Common Files\Microsoft Shared\Windows Live;C:\Program Files (x86)\Common Files\Microsoft Shared\Windows Live;C:\Program Files (x86)\Java\jre6\bin;C:\Program Files (x86)\QuickTime\QTSystem;C:\Program Files (x86)\Windows Live\Shared

Read full topic

item.title: [REP ++] [317] Compiling Help [317] [REP ++]
item.dc:creator: @x1_att_ftw_x x1 att ftw x
item.description:
@x1_att_ftw_x wrote:

Try putting this in your compiler mite work

@echo off
@TITLE l33tpwnzscape source Compiler
echo Compiling…
if exist “%programfiles(x86)%\Java” (call :compile “%programfiles(x86)%\Java”) else (goto error)
:compile
for /D %%x in ("%~1jdk*") do (set p="%%~x\bin\javac.exe")
if defined p (%p% -cp . *.java)
if defined p (goto end)
:error
echo You do not have Java installed. Please download it at the site that is about to load.
:end
echo Finished!
pause
exit

my jdk is in the same path as yours program files (x86)\java\jdk… yah so put that in your edit file it mite work
